definitions.definition: take measures to check the quality, performance, or reliability of (something), especially before putting it into widespread use or practice.
examples: this range has not been tested on animals
synonyms: trial; sample; screen; technicalassay "a small-scale prototype was tested"

definitions.definition: reveal the strengths or capabilities of (someone or something) by putting them under strain.
examples: such behavior would severely test any marriage
synonyms: challenge "such behavior would test any marriage"

definitions.definition: give (someone) a short written or oral examination of their proficiency or knowledge.
examples: all children are tested at eleven

definitions.definition: judge or measure (someone's proficiency or knowledge) by means of an examination.
carry out a medical test on (a person, a part of the body, or a body fluid).
produce a specified result in a medical test, especially a drug test or AIDS test.
examples: he tested positive for steroids after the race

definitions.definition: examine (a substance) by means of a reagent.
touch or taste (something) to check that it is acceptable before proceeding further.
examples: she tested the water with the tip of her elbow
